Welcome to Version Manager

The first time you start Serena ChangeMan Version Manager, you can do the following:

  • Create a new project database which you can use for creating projects and adding files. You can rename the new project database after creation by selecting File | Rename. If you need to create another project database later, select Admin | Create Project Database.
  • Open the sample project database installed with Version Manager. The sample project database contains contains two projects: Bridge, which includes a C++ application and Windows help file, and Chess, which includes a Java application and HTML files.
  • Open the project root that was open the last time you used Version Manager 5.3/6.0.

    After the initial Version Manager startup, you can use this dialog to open all project databases that were open when you last exited Version Manager.

    Field Descriptions

    Create a new project database Select to create a new project database that you can use for creating projects and adding files.
    Open the sample project database Select to open the sample project database. It contains example projects and files that you can work with in order to learn Version Manager concepts such as workspaces, promotion models, and version labels.
    Open my previous 5.2/5.3/6.0 project root Select to open the project root that was open the last time you used Version Manager 5.2, 5.3, or 6.0.
    Open the previously opened project database(s) Select to open all project databases that were open when you last exited Version Manager.
    Don't show this dialog again Select to prevent this dialog box from displaying again.
